oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Invoice of stores delivered by S. H. Stevens, Lieutenant, Chicago Board of Trade Battery Illinois Volunteers, to W. A. Wainwright

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832-1904; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps; Stevens, Sylvanus Harlow, 1827-1902; United States -- Army -- Illinois Artillery -- Chicago Board of Trade Battery (1862-1865); Pioneer (Steamer)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Deliveries from Steamer Pioneer and Steamer Colossus from H. Shoals, Tennessee, are recorded on the same printed form. Their cargo is mostly iron and brass.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-70
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military and commercial steamships were heavily used by both sides during the Civil War, transporting cargo and personnel. Eventually the shipping lines would be put out of business by the growing number of railroad lines.
